item.title: Carrier Neutral Connectivity at Colocation Data Centers
item.description:
By: John Shepler Businesses struggling to find enough bandwidth might be overlooking a simpler solution. Instead of waiting for carriers to come to them, companies can benefit by going where the carriers already are. Colocation Centers: A Hub for Connectivity Carriers are drawn to locations called colocation centers, or colos, and carrier hotels. These large data centers are designed to accommodate multiple tenants, unlike typical data centers that serve a single company...

item.title: 100 Mbps Colocation Center Bandwidth
item.description:

A major advantage of colocation is access to high bandwidth at significantly reduced costs. ](http://www.etherrabbit.com/)Colocation centers, or colos, are facilities that house the data center needs of numerous businesses.
